result.execSummary:
The defendant Adrian D Coleman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid at a rate of $50.00 per month commencing 11/01/2017; alternate 14 days jail. Payment plan fee of $15.00 to be added as well.
DNA to be paid along with fine on payment plan
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Adrian D Coleman in court, in custody, with attorney Cameron Weitzner.  Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Court conducts plea colloquy with defendant.  State makes sentencing recommendation.  Defense makes sentencing recommendation.  Defendant makes statement.  

The Defendant was sentenced as follows:

Count 1:

FINE: $568.00

DNA SURCHARGE:  $200.00
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

To be paid at the rate of $50.00/month commencing November 1, 2017 or serve 14days jail, consecutive, as penalty for non payment of fine.

Defendant Adrian D Coleman in court with attorney Cameron Weitzner.   District Attorney's Office Lindsay Hirt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Sarah Franklin was sworn and testified on behalf of the State. Cross examination by the defense. Officer Nathaniel Schweitzer from the Town of Hartford was sworn and testified on behalf of the state. State presents exhibits #1 DVD, marked. Cross examination by the defense. Exhibit #1 is received. State rests. No testimony by the defense. Court closes testimony. State presents closing arguments. Defense presents closing arguments. Court denied the Motion to Dismiss. Defense requests a hearing date about 30 days out.  Hearing scheduled for August 10, 2016 at 09:30 am.
